summary: This is a transcript of a DOJ Office of the Inspector General interview with New York City Medical Examiner Dr. , conducted on May 31, 2022, regarding the autopsy and determination of cause of death of Jeffrey Epstein. The doctor provides detailed medical findings supporting the conclusion of suicide by hanging and discusses questions about the ligature evidence and scene investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the autopsy and death investigation. The medical examiner discusses the findings from his autopsy conducted on August 11, 2019.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: The witness being interviewed. She conducted Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy on August 11, 2019, and explains her findings, methodology, and conclusion that the cause of death was hanging and the manner was suicide.

persons.context: The primary interviewer from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General, conducting the official investigation into Epstein's death.

persons.name: SAC
persons.context: Also present and asking questions during the OIG interview. The Special Agent-in-Charge for the New York Field Office.

persons.role: General Counsel, NYC Office of Chief Medical Examiner
persons.context: Present during the interview as legal counsel for the medical examiner's office. She confirms the release of the certified medical examiner case file.

persons.name: Dr. Michael Baden
persons.context: The medical examiner hired by Mark Epstein to be present during Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy.

events.title: Autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Dr.  conducts the autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein at the New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.

events.title: Previous suicide attempt by Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found with a noose around his neck in his cell in an apparent suicide attempt.

events.title: OIG Interview with Medical Examiner
events.description: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General interviews Dr.  regarding her autopsy findings and conclusions in the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: New York City Office of the Chief Medical Examiner
Dane County Medical Examiner's Office, Madison, Wisconsin
keyFacts: The medical examiner, Dr. , conducted Epstein's autopsy on August 11, 2019, and concluded the cause of death was hanging and the manner was suicide.

Key autopsy findings included a ligature furrow, petechial hemorrhages on the face and eyes, fractures of the thyroid cartilage and hyoid bone in a pattern consistent with hanging, and a lack of defensive wounds or signs of struggle.
There was confusion and multiple pieces of potential ligature evidence at the scene; the examiner was not fully convinced the item presented to her as the noose was the actual one used.
Toxicology tests detected no substances in Epstein's system at the time of death.
The examiner stated no one attempted to coerce or bribe her into ruling the death a suicide, though she received unpleasant calls from Epstein's family who were unhappy with the determination.
